Key Match Events: Reed Sheppard struggled in his limited first-half minutes, contributing little to the game.
The Rockets trailed 62-41 after the first two quarters, marking a significant turning point.
Stephon Castle played a crucial role for the Spurs, hitting key free throws and defending Houston's top scorers.
Pre-Game Insights: Many fans looked forward to the matchup between Reed Sheppard and Stephon Castle, a key player matchup.
Rockets coach Ime Udoka kept Sheppard on the bench until late in the first quarter, while Gregg Popovich of the Spurs kept Castle in the game despite adversity.
Post-Match Reflections: Sheppard, benched by Udoka, watched helplessly as the Rockets couldn't complete their comeback.
Popovich's strategy of keeping Castle in the game was highlighted as a key factor in the Spurs' victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets' first-half performance was poor, turning a potential rout into a slugfest.
The Spurs' bench, led by Castle, played a pivotal role in securing the win.
